job_title: Patient Service Clerk in Memphis, TN
pros: They have great health benefits
cons: horrible low pay not competitive, doesn't matter if you have a degree or not, the small pay raises up to $15 that they planned on doing is still not fair for a hospital. Too much talk about budgets, they don't have a large enough budget to do anything. Upper management cares nothing about employees from chiefs, directors and on down. when you leave they ask what new job is paying and try to offer you more, no value or appreciation for employees. No room for growth and when they post new jobs 9 times out of 10 they already know who they will choose for the position. They just post the position on the job board and interview one person for HR purposes only. The wont let current employees get overtime to make up for the low pay, because it's not in the budget. They dump a ton of work on employees and expect it to be completed within 8 hrs. They roll out new stuff and give you no training, just confusing and large packets to follow, and expect you to do it right. Some manager make up there own rules based on there dept. not company policy.

job_title: Staff Accountant III in Memphis, TN
pros:
Encouraging, Caring Staff
Opportunity to Learn a Ton
Excellent Leadership
cons: Regional One has a great culture, atmosphere, and there is plenty of opportunity for advancement. Unfortunately, I had a supervisor who did not care about these things. She consistently treated me with contempt and disregard. Whenever I submitted my work, I could hear loud sighing and cursing. This was demoralizing and made me feel like I was not valued. There was also favoritism showed for other team members and I was made to feel isolated, alienated, and not valued. I was perceived as a threat to her advancement and progression in the organization and for this I was mistreated. In the end, I had to leave the organization out of concern for my mental health and to avoid further hostile situations. That aside, I do believe this was circumstantial and that Regional One is an excellent organization to work for. My experience with everyone but my immediate supervisor was nothing by positive and encouraging.

job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in Memphis, TN
pros: The majority of co-workers were very nice and helpful.
cons: The whole facility is old and run down. The elevators are terrible and small and you're expected to transport patients (often vented) on the tiny elevator that can barely fit a patient bed. They are severely understaffed but are not ACTIVELY trying to solve this. There no pay increases or incentives and their ICU nurse-to-patient ratios are extremely unsafe. The neglect that the patients have to go through is terrible. Management cares more about charting than actual patient care. This facility needs a major overhaul.

review_title: Nurse Practitioner Trauma, U.T. Regional One Physicians, mid-level provider
job_title: Trauma Nurse Practitioner Hospitalist With the Trauma Surgery Team in Memphis, TN
pros: Excellent benefits, salary, Work with ~13 trauma physicians & 12 other NP's. covering Trauma ED, Trauma Step-Down/ICU, Post-trauma floors and a Trauma NP clinic. We take care of really sick people and always have back-up. There is a Staff Trauma MD in hospital 24/7/365. ROH has 4 Centers of Excellence:  Level-1 Trauma Center & Level-1 Burn Center, Neonatal ICU, High-risk Obstetrics which see patients from all surrounding states. We are a teaching facility connected to University of Tennessee-Memphis; so we work with student nurses, medical  students, interns and Residents. Regional One Health is a place where you practice your profession, not just take a job. We give high quality care. That is our expectation of all our employees in every profession.
cons: I have worked at Regional One Health for 30 years as a critical care Trauma RN, Patient Care Coordinator and Preceptor for 14 years, then as a trauma hospitalist NP for the last 16 years. I obviously like the place.  Trauma NP's work 12 hour shifts, 3 shifts per week for 3 weeks and 4 shifts per week for the 4th week. We cover weekends and holidays. Day NP's work days, night NP's work nights. We are expected to work 2 days of the Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year group of holidays. We only are expected to work one of the Summer holidays -  Memorial day, July 4th or Labor day; but we are expected to work a 3 day stretch over that holiday, so our colleagues can make out of town plans when they are off. We are allowed to make private plans with each other as long as coverage is unbroken.

pros: Benefits, pay and training are amazing
cons: None so far. Love the work environment and management team our unit.

review_title: I enjoyed and learned alot during my employment!
pros: Very interesting learning environment. Fast paced and must be flexible with time management skills. Some good employees who do not mind assisting when  needed in order to provide quality patient care. CEO and President made the work environment much better after setting forth policies and procedures and following through with there stated repecussion. When bad employees finally realized that they may lose their job after witnessing a few instances, it turned the bad employees into believers and many left Regional One Health which made it a much better work environment for remaining employees and for the patients and their families/caregiveers. Wellness programs (walking on crosswalk and WeightWatchers) and other lunch and learn seminars (ie, financial information) were also very helpful.
cons: To many cliques among management and with some employees and if you are on the outside of their group, oh well, watch out. This occurs in every department throughout the medical center campus. Stay alert and be on the lookout! They will attempt to harass and intimidate you to force you to go along with their group or force you into leaving the hospital. Management includes higher level (executive) managers who are in cliques.

pros: They truly support personal and professional development and career advancement.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Memphis, TN
pros: Patient load was manageable.  The orientation of the unit was well organized and patient care materials and meds were easily accessible.  Surround sight of the unit.  Employee to patient ratio was more than acceptable.  Nurses did not feel over worked. Patient care was important.  Team and unit meetings were held on the floor and were not time consuming as to not take too much time away from patient care.
cons: As with any hospital there were some employees that came just for the check and did not work as a team to help each other.  The manager at the time had favorites, which is also a common problem anywhere you go.

review_title: Great learning opportunity, but not worth the risk
pros: Great pay and benefits. Teaching hospital provides for great learning opportunities. Excellent for skills experience. Many units newly remodeled.
cons: Poor management that doesn't take patient safety into consideration. Very heavy nurse:patient ratios (1:8). Acuity of patients not considered in staffing. No support from upper management. Unit specific: Verbal and physical harassment from management. Always understaffed. Nurses expected to do jobs of PCA's in addition to their own responsibilities. Poor attendance. Favoritism. Discrimination. Very political.

review_title: I cannot give a good review for Regional One Health
pros: People are friendly and the pay is good. The staff for most part is great. Everyone is compassionate and caring.
cons: There is not any type of structure or procedures within the departments. The leadership does not manage for effective results. Staff is stressed and overworked especially management. Management and employees do not have any accountability and this is in all there departments.

review_title: Acute Care Nurse Practitioner in Trauma Division
job_title: Acute Care Nurse Practitioner in Memphis, TN
pros: We care for patients no matter their ability to pay. We have a Level One Trauma Center-the 2nd busiest in the country, a Level One Burn Center, Level One Newborn Critical Care Center, an excellent Women's Hospital with an OB/Gyn department which specializes in high risk pregnancies. In my trauma NP group, our MD supervisors have our backs. We are treated with respect and allowed to use our knowledge in our patient care practice.
cons: More NP's needed. Trauma NP's coverTrauma ICU/Stepdown Unit 24/7, Trauma ED 24/7, 2 trauma floors and an NP clinic.

job_title: Director Employee Relations in Memphis, TN
pros: Employees work there because they are all about the business of saving lives, whether you are a clinician, work in housekeeping or in administration that is the driving passion for the employees.
cons: Exceptionally poor executive leadership and management.  Decisions made at that level are reactive versus proactive.  If issues arise, executive leadership looks for blame versus trying to find out what was the issue and what was the breakdown in the process.

pros: Large varied environment. Very positive organization. Relatively updated equipment. Minimal managerial interference. Passionate employees. There wasn't a lot of positive here. Just wasn't
cons: Lack of IT Vision. Most of staff came over from an abandoned Outsourced IT project, and it shows. Focus on status quo and letting the vendors drive IT. Management's lack of understanding of IT, and laws that affect IT puts organization and employees at risk of legal action

review_title: More support staff would make this a better work environment.
pros: Interesting patients, good learning opportunities. Nursing staff did not have a hostile attitude toward new nurses so the chance to learn was present.  Never a dull moment and the 12 hour shifts never seemed long.
cons: Shortages of almost all staff make some tasks difficult or unsafe.  Support staff necessary to perform basic nursing care is almost non-existent on some floors.  Night staffing was bare bones at best.
